project_metadata.project_name: Supply, Testing and Delivery of (15) Custom Made Datalogger for Panay River Basin
project_metadata.client_name: Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA)

visual_inspection.notes: (1) No visual defects observed during inspection. (2) Unit paired with MCB Serial No. 23010183.

electrical_tests.measured: Verified functional operation within the 9V to 30V input range.

electrical_tests.expected: Device powers down upon SW2 actuation
electrical_tests.measured: Quiescent current drops to ~0.05mA at 12V input.
Measured values fall within specified tolerance limits.
Cut-off triggered at 32.8V. Recommendation: Operating voltage should remain below this threshold.

electrical_tests.expected: System shutdown if total current reaches 6.12A (±5.1%) or total power reaches ~100W
electrical_tests.measured: Fault indicator activated (ref: E-07), followed by immediate system shutdown.

electrical_tests.expected: Auto-retry; system consecutively checks for fault clearance
electrical_tests.measured: System performs bistable reset if fault persists; normal operation resumes upon fault removal.

electrical_tests.expected: LED illuminates (near the power reset switch) during undervoltage lockout (E-03) or power fail detection (E-05)
electrical_tests.measured: Indicator illuminates at the specified voltage thresholds.

electrical_tests.expected: LED illuminates (near the 3-pin header) when input voltage reaches ~11.89V
electrical_tests.measured: Indicator illuminates at the specified voltage thresholds.
E-Fuse successfully blocked current flow through the input section.

electrical_tests.expected: RCB present between eFuse and power monitoring. Power must be supplied only via dedicated input ports to prevent failure.
electrical_tests.measured: Advisory: Power must be supplied exclusively via the DC barrel jack or to the dedicated MCB Terminal Block to prevent unrecoverable device failure.

electrical_tests.expected: Regulated output voltage of 5.0V with continuous load capability of up to 5.0A.
electrical_tests.measured: Verified stable output regulation under full 5.0A load conditions; voltage ripple verified within specifications.

electrical_tests.expected: Automatic entry into hiccup protection mode upon detection of short-circuit.
electrical_tests.measured: System successfully entered hiccup mode during fault simulation, limiting excessive power dissipation; automatic recovery confirmed upon fault clearance.
Temperature stabilized at ≤110°C under 5A load (12V input). Recommendation: Passive heatsink must remain installed to ensure thermal stability.
Measured output is within tolerance limits.

electrical_tests.parameter: [Power] +3.3V Rails: LDOs for Modem and MCU Peripherals
electrical_tests.expected: Dropout voltage ≤400mV at constant output current ≥2A
electrical_tests.measured: Measured dropout voltage is significantly below the maximum specification.

functional_tests.observation: SWD interface continuity verified; successful firmware upload to the Hardware Accelerator (HA) SoM.

functional_tests.feature: [PTSA: Flash] Enabling access port protection mechanism
functional_tests.observation: Security protection active; readback attempts trigger a full page erase.

functional_tests.feature: [PTSA: Flash] Signing keys for Device Firmware Upgrade (DFU)
functional_tests.observation: Digital signature verification active; unsigned applications are rejected.
Long press functionality successfully initiates the DFU process.
All shell commands verified functional. Available commands include: sim_pwr, sys_info, power_ctrl, sys_reboot, buzzer (control/toggle), sdi, retval, history, help, and stats.
SDI-12 Analog Front End (AFE) functions correctly. Validated with SenseCAP CO2 (SKU 101991028) and OTT-RLS water level sensors.
Independent control verified for eFuse, Buck Converter, and modem power rails.
System power-up is successfully inhibited when the MCU is removed.
Successful execution of SDI-12 commands to Hardware Accelerator (ref: F-06) via UART1.
Custom binary compiled for Bluetooth SPP support (OTA functionality disabled). Firmware version verified via AT+GMR.
Successful execution of AT commands to on-board WiFi/BLE modem via UART2.
5V-tolerant protocol confirmed on UART6. Recommendation: Install a 100-ohm termination resistor near the terminal block to mitigate market-variant AFE impedance mismatches.
Successful execution of AT commands to PTSA cellular modem via UART6.
CANH and CANL lines demonstrate correct recessive and dominant logic levels. Testing utilized UART translation, with the CAN software layer executed at the MCU level.
UART protocol functionality confirmed at RS232 logic levels via UART8.
Half-duplex communication confirmed via UART4 without requiring an additional direction control pin. Recommendation: Inverting lines must be terminated with a compatible RS485 device during testing.
UART protocol functionality confirmed at RS232 logic levels via UART5.
Signal debouncing algorithm correctly identifies and filters input noise.
Discrepancy identified in the on-board reset button net routing. Reset functionality is verified and accessible via the dedicated terminal block interface.
Input signal (60kHz sine wave, 14Vpp) successfully clamped to ~5V by on-board Zener diodes. Warning: Input signals exceeding MCU pin tolerances are not recommended despite clamping.

functional_tests.feature: [MCB: Hardware/Firmware] Medium Quality Sound (MQS), left and right channel
functional_tests.observation: Audio output verified on both channels via amplifier; playback quality is clear.
LED status indicators operate synchronously with control code.
Communication established with all on-board I2C devices at addresses: 0x40, 0x48, 0x49, 0x4A, 0x4B, and 0x60.
Optional feature verified; Ethernet interface is functional when hardware is populated.
Power supply and I2C control signals verified for external OLED module.
Functionality confirmed; all values measured within expected tolerances.
Logic output confirmed functional with 3.3V signal relay.

test_results.errata_notes: (1) Assembly Note: Due to PCB space constraints, terminal blocks must be installed in an alternating configuration rather than consecutively. If a connection is required at a non-populated position, wires may be soldered directly to the pad. These assembly constraints do not impact the functional performance or electrical characteristics of the device. (2) Revision Note: The routing discrepancy identified in F-19 has been rectified in Revision B hardware
